subject: Art & Design
title: Digital Fashion: Clothes That Don't Exist
description: Learn Digital Fashion: Clothes That Don't Exist in one minute.

hook.text: A digital-only dress sold for $9,500 in 2019. It was photoshopped onto the buyer.

buildup.text: Digital fashion creates garments that exist only in virtual spaces: social media filters, gaming avatars.

discovery.text: It produces zero waste, requires no shipping, and allows unlimited creative freedom â€” physics doesn't apply.

twist.text: If fashion is about identity and status, does the garment need to physically exist? Digital fashion says no.

climax.text: Balenciaga designed for Fortnite. Gucci sold virtual bags on Roblox. Fashion is entering the virtual economy.

punchline.text: The next fashion revolution might not involve fabric at all.

quiz.question: What advantage does digital fashion have over physical fashion?
options: Zero waste, no shipping, and unlimited creative freedom beyond physical constraints
It's always cheaper than physical clothing
Digital clothes last forever without degrading
